info.description:
# About
This is the reference for the Panaya API. Panaya provides powerful API capabilities that easily integrate with your existing management tools. The API allows you to manage Panaya resources such as defects, features, and requirements. This page documents all supported entities and the available functions, along with expected HTTP response codes and sample requests.


# Getting Started

If you are new to our API, we recommend that you first refer to our [Step by Step Guide to Panaya APIs](http://success.panaya.com/Setup-Configuration/APIs/951700501/Step-by-Step-Guide-to-Panaya-APIs.htm) . The examples in the Guide show you with how to retrieve your session token and perform API functions.


# Pagination
The _pageSize_ and _pageNumber_ query parameters let you control pagination.
* Use the _pageSize_ parameter to define the number of items to be displayed on one page. The default value of '0' displays all items on one page.
* Use the _pageNumber_ parameter to display a specific page.

# Ordering
Panaya API resources that return all of a specified type of element, such as defects or features, support ordering of the elements in the response on a specific field. The list can be ordered in ascending or descending order, with ascending being the default.
You can order the elements in response on a given field using the order query parameter with - or + signs. The field can be either a text string (STRING_field) or a selected field (SINGLE_SELECT_field).
* "field"+ orders by the specified field ascending.
* "field"- orders by the specified field descending.

# Querying
Panaya API resources that return all of a specified type of element, such as defects or features, support querying to return only those elements that match the query parameters.
The following query types are supported

* Field type = STRING - return all elements matching the specified text string
* Field type = FLOAT/DOUBLE - a range of values
  * "minValue 0.3,maxValue 0.8" - return all elements within the specified range of values
  * "maxValue 0.8" – return all elements less than the specified value
  * "minValue 0.3" – return all elements greater than the specified value
* Field type = SINGLE_SELECT – return all elements matching the selected value
* Field type = INTEGER – return all elements matching the specified value
* Field type = USER - return all elements matching the specified value in the format xx@yyy.com
* Field type = BOOLEAN – return all elements matching the selected value "true" or "false"
* Field type = DATE – a range of dates
  * "datesRange,yyyy-MM-dd''T''HH:mm:ss,yyyy-MM-dd''T''HH:mm:ss" - return all elements within the specified range of dates
  * "datesRange,yyyy-MM-dd''T''HH:mm:ss" - return all elements after the specified date
  * "blanks" - return all elements regardless of date|
        


# **Example**

URL/api/v1/projects/{{projectId}}/{entityType}?query={query}&fields={fields}&order={order}&pageSize={pageSize}&pageNumber={pageNumber}

  Below is a private example

  https://emea.panaya.com/api/v1/projects/1234/requirements?query="Last Modified Date"=datesRange,2018-09-13T00:00:01,2018-09-13T23:59:59&fields="ID", "Description","Last Modified Date"&order="Last Modified Date"-&pageSize=1&pageNumber=2
  
  * Server EMEA
  * Project 1234
  * Modified on Sept 13, 2018
  * Fields to return - ID, Description, Last Modified Date
  * Page Size 1 - returns 1 items per page
  * Page Number 2 - returns the 2nd page
